snippet: Zakia and Mohammad Ali had faced criminal charges and death threats after eloping and fleeing their village in the high mountains of central Afghanistan last year.
abstract: Zakia and Mohammad Ali, couple who fled mountain town of Bamian, Afghanistan, in 2014 under threat of criminal charges and death after eloping against their families' wishes, have returned home, but are living in constant state of fear; village police have promised them safety but both Zakia, a Sunni Muslim, and Mohammad, a Shiite Muslim, question how much real protection they will have.
lead_paragraph: Zakia and Mohammad Ali had faced criminal charges and death threats after eloping and fleeing their village in the high mountains of central Afghanistan last year.

headline.main: Back in Afghanistan, Modern Romeo and Juliet Face Grave Risks
headline.print_headline: Back in Afghanistan, Modern Romeo and Juliet Face Grave Risks
